main.server

Class ClientThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • main.server.ClientThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ClientThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class for handling Client requests to the server and functioning as a player in the gameThreads of the server.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dr√© van Oorschot, Andrei Raureanu

      Handles the CONNECT method of the protocol.

      Disconnects the current ClientThread, which means taking the ClientThread out of the connected clients list of the server and sending a message to the client it disconnected

      • ClientThread

        public ClientThread(java.net.Socket s,
                    Server svr)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new ClientThread object.
        Parameters:
        s - socket of the client
        svr - server where the clientThread is running on
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Handles the client input and responds accordingly to the protocol methods send by the client.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String[] text)
             throws UserAlreadyConnectedException
        Handles the CONNECT method of the protocol. Puts the ClientThread in the list of connected clients of the server if the chosen name is not already assigned to another ClientThread.
        Parameters:
        text - name of the Client
        Throws:
        UserAlreadyConnectedException - thrown when another ClientThread already has the given name.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws IllegalMethodUseException
        Disconnects the current ClientThread, which means taking the ClientThread out of the connected clients list of the server and sending a message to the client it disconnected
        Throws:
        IllegalMethodUseException - thrown when the ClientThread does not occur in the connected clients list.

      • readyClient

        public void readyClient()
                 throws IllegalMethodUseException
        Puts the ClientThread inside the ready clients list of the server. And notifies the client this operation has been done.
        Throws:
        IllegalMethodUseException - thrown when the client is not in the connected clients list or is already in the ready clients list.

      • unReadyClient

        public void unReadyClient()
                   throws IllegalMethodUseException
        Take ClientThread out of the ready client list of the server and notifies the client this operation has done so.
        Throws:
        IllegalMethodUseException - thrown when the client was not in the ready client list in the first place.

      • doMove

        public void doMove(java.lang.String[] text)
            throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Parses the input of the method into a Integer[] and assigns these values to the move buffer. The move buffer can later be used to determine a move of the player.
        Parameters:
        text - the to be parsed content containing the move
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

      • writePlayersAll

        public void writePlayersAll()
        Sends the client a list of all the clients that are connected to the server.

      • getClientName

        public java.lang.String getClientName()
        Returns the name of the client.
        Returns:
        name of the client

      • getMark

        public Mark getMark()
        Returns the mark the client plays with.
        Returns:
        mark of the client

      • getMoveBuffer

        public java.lang.Integer[] getMoveBuffer()
        Returns the content of the move buffer.
        Returns:
        client's move buffer

      • getServer

        public Server getServer()
        Returns the server in which this ClientThread is being run.
        Returns:
        server in which the ClientThread runs.

      • getGameThread

        public ServerGameThread getGameThread()
        Returns the gameThread in which the ClientThread is participating, if it is participating in one.
        Returns:
        GameThread in which the ClientThread is participating or null if the ClientThread is not participating in a game at the moment

      • setMoveBuffer

        public void setMoveBuffer(java.lang.Integer[] moveBuffer)
        Sets the move buffer to 2 coordinates.
        Parameters:
        moveBuffer - the move the Client wishes to make

      • setMark

        public void setMark(Mark mark)
        Set the mark where the client will be playing with in a game.
        Parameters:
        mark - mark the client is going to play with.

      • setGameThread

        public void setGameThread(ServerGameThread gameThread)
        Set the gameThread for this ClientThread
        Parameters:
        gameThread -

      • writeToClient

        public void writeToClient(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a message to the client.
        Parameters:
        msg - String you wish to send to the client
